intro: Baphiastrum micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered baphia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical Africa, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences at the ends of the branches. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a leathery texture and a smooth margin. Baphiastrum micranthum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive appearance.
